poem:
### Disorder in the Aisles

Amidst our digital age,  
a glitch severed thread and bread—  
Marks & Spencer, undressed,  
stripped by unseen hands,  
scans empty of parcels,  
cyber rushes—  
chaos tailored neatly,  
frayed economy  
on a woven whim.  
Silent tills echo  
a ghostly commerce.  
Fill the cart—  
gap of zeros.  
What cost,  
this modern absence?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Clothing shortages, food waste and millions lost each day: inside the M&S cyber-attack chaos Unusual activity on tech systems over the Easter weekend was the first sign of a sustained cyber-attack on Marks & Spencer, which is costing the retailer millions of pounds a day. The group, the UK’s biggest clothing retailer which accounts for a third of underwear sales alongside food and homewares, has now been forced to stop taking online orders for more". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
